div.div: Νέστωρ : Nestor, the aged king of Pylos, son of Neleus and Chloris, was ruling over the 3d generation of men when he joined the expedition against Troy, Il. 1.247 ff. His youthful exploits, Il. 4.319, Il. 11.669 ff., Il. 1.262 ff., Il. 23.630 ff. In the Odyssey he is at home again in Pylos, Od. 3.17, cf. 412 ff.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
